oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Promise Land: memorial park
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Promise Land Rd., N of Reddon Crossing/Will G Rd, Promise, Dickson Co., TN
Color photograph of a field with leaves on the ground and bare trees; white sign titled "Bowen Memorial Park"

Freed slaves established Promise Land shortly after the Civil War. It was the first African American community of Dickson County. In time, is encompassed about 1000 acres, including 50 homes, several stores, two churches, and a school. Only the St. John Church and the schoolhouse remains.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Parks; Signs (Notices)
